createCancelButtonForDetailWindows

public com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.button.Button createCancelButtonForDetailWindows(IDetailPanel detailPanel,
                                                                                       com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.Window w)
Creates a button to cancel the actions in a detail panel and close the window.
When selected, the button prompts for confirm only if the detailPanel is dirty.
The created button is not added automatically to any container (caller must do that).

Parameters:
detailPanel -
Returns:

createCancelButtonForDetailPanels

public <W extends com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.Window & IDetailPanel> com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.button.Button createCancelButtonForDetailPanels(W wDetail)
Type Parameters:
W -
Parameters:
wDetail -
Returns:

createSaveButtonForDetailPanels

public <C extends com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.Component & IDetailPanel> com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.button.Button createSaveButtonForDetailPanels(C detailPanel,
                                                                                                                                                       com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.event.SelectionListener<com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.event.ButtonEvent> listener,
                                                                                                                                                       List<com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.Component> changeSourceComponents,
                                                                                                                                                       IComponentListeningStrategy context)
Creates a "Save" button for the passed detail panel.
The button is configured to be initially enabled only if the passed detail panel has valid values. Its enabled state may change according to changes in the components of the passed changeSourceComponents param: on each Change event capture, the valid and dirty states are checked on the passed detail panel and the created button state will be enabled only if both are true.
Since the valid state is checked, notice that every component MUST be initialized with its corresponding data.
The created button is not automatically added to any container.

Parameters:
detailPanel -
listener -
Returns:
created Button

createApplyButtonForDetailPanels

public <C extends com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.Component & IDetailPanel> com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.button.Button createApplyButtonForDetailPanels(C detailPanel,
                                                                                                                                                        com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.event.SelectionListener<com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.event.ButtonEvent> listener,
                                                                                                                                                        List<com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.Component> changeSourceComponents,
                                                                                                                                                        IComponentListeningStrategy context)
Creates a "Apply" button for the passed detail panel.
The button is configured to be initially enabled only if the passed detail panel has valid values. Its enabled state may change according to changes in the components of the passed changeSourceComponents param: on each Change event capture, the valid and dirty states are checked on the passed detail panel and the created button state will be enabled only if both are true.
Since the valid state is checked, notice that every component MUST be initialized with its corresponding data.
The apply button is not automatically added to any container.

Parameters:
detailPanel -
listener -
Returns:
created Button

addTrashIconButton
